Can I declare workspaces that automatically find packages in nested directories?

Yes, you can declare workspaces that automatically find packages in nested directories by using glob patterns. The example you provided already uses glob patterns (`apps/*` and `libs/*`), which will match any directories directly under `apps` and `libs`. If you want to include packages in nested directories, you can use a double asterisk (`**`) to match any level of nesting.

Here is an updated example that includes nested directories:

```json
{
  "workspaces": [
    "apps/**",
    "libs/**"
  ]
}
```

This configuration will match packages in any nested directories under `apps` and `libs`. For example, it will include `apps/foo`, `apps/foo/bar`, `libs/baz`, and `libs/baz/qux`.
